business.headline: Will your home loan EMIs fall as HDFC, PNB, and 3 other banks cut lending rates?With several banks adjusting their lending rates downwards, home loan customers may soon notice a drop in their EMIs.

Sensex tumbles over 700 points: Why is the stock market down today?Broader markets mirrored the weak sentiment, with mid-cap and small-cap stocks witnessing sharper cuts than frontline indices. Intraday volatility also spiked, signalling heightened nervousness on Dalal Street.

Waiting for Meesho IPO shares? Check your allotment status, expected profit hereInvestors can check whether they have received Meesho shares through either the BSE website or the registrar, Kfin Technologies Ltd.

No advisory issued to stop clean energy funding, says governmentThe Ministry has further noted that calibrated and well-informed financing across the solar manufacturing ecosystem will drive sustainable industry growth and has asked multiple financial institutions to take note of it.

GoT, Harry Potter and more: Netflix notifies users about big Warner Bros takeoverNetflix has begun informing subscribers via email that it is in the final stages of acquiring Warner Bros Discovery's film, TV, and streaming businesses, in a deal valued at $72 billion.
Why young, wealthy Indians are skipping the West for DubaiWhy is Dubai now outperforming the West in attracting young Indian investors and professionals? Have a look.

IndiGo crisis, inflation, capacity: How Centre fixed Rs 7,500–18,000 fare capsIndia's Ministry of Civil Aviation has imposed emergency caps on domestic airfares following IndiGo's massive flight cancellations, aiming to protect passengers from soaring ticket prices during the peak travel season. This intervention seeks to stabilise the market amid one of the worst aviation disruptions in recent years.

entertainment.headline: Bus kar, pagli: Ranveer Singh has a cute reply to Sara Arjun's emotional post Ranveer Singh responded to Sara Arjun's heartfelt post with his trademark humour on Monday. She has made her Hindi film debut opposite him in 'Dhurandhar'.

Balakrishna's Akhanda 2: Thaandavam reportedly gets a release date? Check details Nandamuri Balakrishna's Akhanda 2: Thaandavam was postponed from its December 5 slot after financial issues stalled the release. The team is now working toward a December 12 release.

Actor Bhagyashri Borse opens up on faith, fans praise her simplicity Actor Bhagyashri Borse reflected on her childhood relationship with faith, comparing her bond with God to that of a father, a candid moment that drew warm praise from fans.

Kate Winslet finds weight-loss drug use terrifying; slams botox, fillers Kate Winslet called the pervasive use of weight-loss drugs and injectables like Botox "terrifying," urging young women to accept natural ageing and questioning the aspirational beauty standards driven by social media.

Boys were on fire: Vijay Deverakonda gives shout-out to Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar Aditya Dhar's new spy-thriller Dhurandhar, led by Ranveer Singh, opened to a strong box-office run in December 2025, drawing a mix of praise and criticism from audiences and reviewers alike. Vijay Deverakonda also joined the list.

Pranit More on being shamed for looks, background on Bigg Boss 19: It was difficult Pranit More opens up about his emotional journey and challenges on Bigg Boss 19. He shares how bullying and friendships shaped his experience on the show.

Who is Sunaina Yella? Indian actor dating UAE influencer Khalid Al Ameri Tamil actor Sunainaa and UAE influencer Khalid Al Ameri have drawn fresh attention online after sharing new photos together, adding momentum to long-standing rumours about their relationship.

Ajith's playful "You want to be like me?" moment with young fan goes viral Tamil actor Ajith Kumar shared a warm moment with fans in Malaysia while preparing for the Asian Le Mans Series. In the video, the actor can be seen talking to the children and posing for pictures with them.

Kick 2: Salman Khan confirms filming for the sequel during Bigg Boss 19 finale Salman Khan announced he has started work on the much-awaited sequel to Kick. He shared the exciting news during his appearance at the Bigg Boss 19 grand finale.

Who is Dileep, the Malayalam star acquitted in the 2017 actor assault case? Being acquitted in the 2017 actor assault case after eight-and-a-half years has trained pan-India focus on Malayalam actor Dileep, especially as the verdict could mark a turning point in his film career and public image.

Akshaye deserves Oscar for Dhurandhar: Farah recalls Tees Maar Khan gag On Monday, filmmaker Farah Khan commented on Akshaye Khanna's role in Dhurandhar. She humorously said that he 'deserves an Oscar'. The remark was in reference to their previous collaboration in 'Tees Maar Khan'.

Aamir Khan and Kareena Kapoor to star in 3 Idiots 2 after 15 years: Report Aamir Khan and Kareena Kapoor are reuniting for the sequel to the cult classic 3 Idiots. The project was prioritised after Rajkumar Hirani paused his Dadasaheb Phalke biopic.

Singer Kanika Kapoor grabbed on stage at Meghalaya fest, raises safety outrage A fan unexpectedly approached Kanika Kapoor during her Me'gong Festival performance in Meghalaya, grabbing her. The unfortunate act has led to questions about event security for performers.

Saira Banu on Dharmendra's birth anniversary: He shone differently Saira Banu shared heartfelt reflections on late actor Dharmendra's legacy and his close connection with Dilip Kumar. Her social media tribute came on the occasion of Dharmendra's birth anniversary.

Tanya Mittal says Bigg Boss 19 hurt her self-esteem but she stayed true Tanya Mittal reveals how her self-esteem was affected during Bigg Boss 19. She credits Salman Khan's support for helping her stay strong throughout the show.

Dhurandhar's 3 hour, 32 minutes runtime feels justified as its eight chapters unfold Dhurandhar is creating buzz with its eight-chapter structure and 3hr 32 min runtime. Some find it long, while many say the story keeps you hooked till the end. With its mix of action, drama, and real-life-inspired moments, the film gives audiences plenty to stay invested in.

Old melodies, new mayhem: How Dhurandhar gives killer twist to retro songs In Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar, retro melodies don't just return, they resurrect with a vengeance. Old favourites are retooled into thumping, adrenaline-fuelled accomplices to chaos, in a way that they just leave you hooked.

Bigg Boss 19: Kamya Punjabi, Rajiv Adatia and others congratulate Gaurav Khanna As Gaurav Khanna celebrates his 'Bigg Boss 19' win, several celebrities have shared their wishes online. Kamya Punjabi shared her enthusiasm for Khanna's win, while Rajiv praised the actor's growth and perseverance.

general news.headline: Goa club owner's another ticking time bomb: Illegally built on govt land, no safetyVisuals show that the club is still on the beach and that during high tide, waves hit the loft of the club. Activist Ravi Harmalkar described it as a ticking time bomb, warning that another tragedy could have occurred.

Why DMK wants to impeach Madras High Court judge and what is Thiruparankundram row?What began as a dispute over where a traditional lamp should be lit has spiralled into a confrontation involving judiciary, government, political parties, and religious groups.

Communalists behind Vande Mataram objection: Priyanka reads Nehru's letter, slams PMCiting the 1937 letter written by former Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru to Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose, Priyanka Gandhi said, "The so-called objection against the remaining stanzas of Vandra Mataram was manufactured by the communalists." She went on to say that PM Modi did not mention this part in his speech.

We can't run an airline: Supreme Court declines urgent hearing of IndiGo crisisThe issue was mentioned by a lawyer who told the Bench that passengers were suffering as flights were being cancelled without any prior intimation.

Six 6E ideas to keep IndiGo flying and profitableTo remain profitable, IndiGo went where no budget airline in India dared to go. But regular off days for pilots will chip into the airline's profits. Here are some bright ideas to make 6E stay profitable. Read till the end.

Punjab Congress suspends Navjot Kaur Sidhu after 'Rs 500 crore CM post' remarkA day after Congress leader Navjot Kaur Sidhu triggered a political row by claiming that the party takes "Rs 500 crore in a suitcase" from anyone aspiring to become Chief Minister, the state unit on Monday suspended her with immediate effect. The official letter has not stated any reason for the sudden move.

IndiGo submits response to Centre in 'highly-guarded' letter; top officials summoned UpdatesThe airline operated 1,500 flights on Saturday and 1,650 on Sunday, reconnecting most of its destinations, but normalcy has yet to return.

DMK MPs move to impeach judge over hilltop lamp lighting order: SourcesDMK MPs are attempting to move an impeachment motion against a Madras High Court judge. The move follows his order to allow Karthigai Deepam lighting on Thiruparankundram hills. The Tamil Nadu government refused, citing law and order issues.

Dravida and Aryavrat: Land, Lines, Layers, LegendsThe Aryavrat of Manu had the Vindhyas as its southern border. Ancient works repeatedly identify the same Vindhyas as Dravida's northern frontier. In literature and in land, the lines seem clear.

Who is Kazakh dancer Kristina, who says Indian god saved her from Goa fire?A clip of a dancer at a Goa nightclub where 26 people were killed in a fire tragedy has gone viral. Moments after the blaze, Kristina, the dancer from Kazakhstan, was about to enter the very room where the fire is believed to have started. Kristina later said that a teammate's warning, whom she described as an "Indian god", saved her life.

Was Vande Mataram broken up to appease Muslims? Here are the factsPM Narendra Modi said crucial verses of Vande Mataram were removed, and called it the "division and partition of the song" that fuelled India's Partition. The two stanzas of Vande Mataram that were originally written by Bankim Chandra Chatterjee were adopted by the Congress leadership. Six stanzas with references to Hindu deities were dropped. This is what historians say about adoption of the truncated version.

Fake doctors on call on Blinkit? Experts flag 30-second antibiotic prescriptionBlinkit's doctor-call service has raised several questions about accountability, mostly blurring the line between accessibility and safety. Doctors warn strongly against this practice as it only worsens India's antibiotic resistance crisis.

Pigeon enters IndiGo flight amid ongoing crisis, passengers record viral momentKarn Parekh, who was one of the passengers on the IndiGo flight, recorded the scene showing the pigeon flapping around the aisle as travellers laughed, filmed the moment and tried to coax it toward the exit.

Live: Vande Mataram should be honoured like Jana-Gana-Mana, says Rajnath SinghParliament Winter Session Live: Prime Minister Narendra Modi opened a 10-hour discussion in the Lok Sabha on Monday to mark the 150th anniversary of the national song Vande Mataram, a discussion expected to highlight several significant and lesser-known facets of its history, followed by a one-day special discussion in the Rajya Sabha on Tuesday led by the Home Minister.

Delhi High Court to hear plea on IndiGo's 'unchecked rule violations' on Dec 19The PIL, filed in view of the unprecedented operational disruptions for the past one week, seeks directions to the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) and Ministry of Civil Aviation to establish a mandatory compensation mechanism for passengers affected by mass flight disruptions.

The Right to Disconnect Bill and the myth of the unconnected human in age of AIIn an AI-driven world where algorithms never sleep, India's Right to Disconnect Bill offers minor comfort. Because the unconnected human is a myth, our attention belongs to the endless hum of digital life.

The online hit song highlights Rehman's menacing aura with its pulsating beats.

There is massive public scrutiny of its high-profile board of directors now. Despite intervening on Day 1 of IndiGo flight cancellations, questions are being asked about why the board failed in oversight.

China wants revenge: Chinese virologist who linked Covid to Wuhan lab is scaredChinese virologist Li-Meng Yan, who fled to the US after claiming Covid-19 was developed in a Wuhan lab, says she fears Beijing is using her family to lure her back to China. Meanwhile, her husband, virologist Ranawaka Perera, who hasn't spoken to her since she fled, wants to speak to her once to confirm her safety, even as Yan remains in hiding.

This mid-size SUV rockets to 222kmph at Natrax in high-speed testTata's all-new Sierra has demonstrated its performance potential by hitting 222kmph at Natrax, showcasing the strength of its new Hyperion turbo-petrol engine.

Malayalam actor Dileep acquitted in 2017 assault case, says my life was ruinedA Kerala court acquitted Malayalam actor Dileep in the 2017 actor assault case after an eight-year trial. He was accused of conspiracy and destroying evidence. Accused one to six were convicted of rape, conspiracy and abduction. Their sentencing is scheduled for December 12.

How South Africa plan to counter in-form Abhishek Sharma in T20I series vs India South Africa T20I captain Aiden Markram put a premium on Abhishek Sharma's wicket, saying the new-age Indian opener embodies the fearless and ultra-aggressive style of play that has reshaped the format.

IND vs SA 1st T20I Predicted XIs: Sanju Samson vs Jitesh Sharma in wicketkeeper race IND vs SA 1st T20I Predicted XIs: Selection intrigue peaks in Cuttack as India weigh their options for the wicketkeeper with the Samson–Jitesh duel, Gill's return and Nortje's comeback shaping a gripping start to the T20I series.

Relieved by Ro-Ko absence, South Africa ready with fresh plans for India: Markram IND vs SA, 1st T20I: South Africa captain Aiden Markram admitted he is relieved by the absence of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, but maintained that India remain a formidable force in the shortest format.

Mitchell Marsh giving up Test return hopes? Australia star makes big career decision Australia all-rounder Mitchell Marsh will retire from Sheffield Shield cricket at the end of the 2025–26 season, putting his future in Test cricket in serious doubt.

Gautam Gambhir advised to stop picking fights after jibe at Parth Jindal Aakash Chopra has urged Gautam Gambhir to moderate his tone following a fiery press conference after India's ODI series win against South Africa. The advice comes amid Gambhir's criticism of media and Delhi Capitals co-owner Parth Jindal.

1st T20I: Suryakumar Yadav continues to be captain cool at pressers IND vs SA, 1st T20I: Suryakumar Yadav once again lived up to his "captain cool" persona as he fielded questions with trademark composure on the eve of the first T20I against South Africa. Asked about India's unusual new approach at the toss and the team's recent streak of losses, Suryakumar dismissed any fuss around the method, saying he was more than happy to follow KL Rahul's lead for the series. "I'll do it with my left hand as well," he smiled.

Chess: R Praggnanandhaa qualifies for 2026 Candidates after winning FIDE Circuit India's chess prodigy has gone on to win the FIDE Circuit 2025 tournament, securing his position in the upcoming edition of the Candidates tournament, set to begin in 2026.

IND vs SA T20I series Live Streaming: Squads, schedule and all you need to know IND vs SA: India and South Africa will kick off a five-match T20I series on December 9 in Cuttack, with the first match at Barabati Stadium and the final one in Ahmedabad on December 19.

Despite 2-1 triumph, India penalised in ODI series against South Africa IND vs SA: India were fined for a slow over-rate in the second ODI in Raipur, but still showcased impressive batting and bowling to secure the series against South Africa.

Hardik Pandya's return unlocks new combinations, balance for India: Suryakumar Yadav IND vs SA T20Is: With the five-match T20I series against South Africa set to begin, India's preparation for the 2026 T20 World Cup is informed by recent stability in team selection and the return of key all-rounder Hardik Pandya, as confirmed by captain Suryakumar Yadav.

Smriti Mandhana back in nets after saying wedding is off, brother shares photoSmriti Mandhana returned to training at what appears to be a private facility. The India cricketer's brother shared a photo of her practising, accompanied by a heart emoji, a day after her wedding was officially called off.

Ricky Ponting hits out at Jofra Archer for fiery Steve Smith exchange at GabbaAshes, Australia vs England Gabba Test: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting did not hold back as he publicly slammed Jofra Archer for trying to sledge Steve Smith in the closing stages of the second Ashes Test at the Gabba in Brisbane.

IND vs SA: Suryakumar Yadav keeps mum on Rinku Singh's snub ahead of 1st T20IIndia T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav chose not to comment on Rinku Singh's omission ahead of the South Africa series. Rinku has been dropped from the team ahead of the five-match series and is playing in Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy for Uttar Pradesh.

Shubman Gill vs Sanju Samson as T20I opener? Surya explains big selection callIndia vs South Africa, Cuttack T20I: Captain Suryakumar Yadav justified India's decision to hand the opening spot to Shubman Gill in place of Sanju Samson. The skipper added that Samson remains in contention, alongside Jitesh Sharma, for the wicketkeeper-batter's role in the build-up to the T20 World Cup 2026.

Pakistan squad unlikely to see major changes before T20 World Cup: Salman AghaPakistan captain Salman Ali Agha has offered fresh insight into how his side is likely to shape their squad for next year's ICC T20 World Cup in India and Sri Lanka, suggesting that the core group that has featured over recent months will remain largely unchanged.

Salah is destroying his legacy, has thrown Liverpool under the bus: RooneyFormer Manchester United forward Wayne Rooney has questioned Mohamed Salah's explosive Liverpool rant, saying the Egyptian star has thrown the club under the bus and is destroying his Premier League legacy.

Watch: Sania Mirza turns coach for son Izhaan in adorable Tennis sessionFormer tennis star Sania Mirza was seen coaching her son Izhaan in a heartwarming tennis session. Sania's mother Nasima shared the training video with fans.

Dhoni is very unique, we should be proud that he was born in India: Murali VijayFormer India and Chennai Super Kings (CSK) opener Murali Vijay, who spent a significant part of his international and IPL career under MS Dhoni's leadership, believes Indians should feel "proud" that a player of Dhoni's calibre was born in this country.

Baroda's Amit Passi equals world record with hundred on T20 debutAmit Passi hit 114 runs off 55 balls in his T20 debut for Baroda in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy on Monday in Hyderabad. His innings matched the world record for highest individual score on T20 debut.

Virat Kohli begins new chapter, announces partnership with Agilitas after Puma exitVirat Kohli announced his partnership with Indian sportswear startup Agilitas Sports on Monday, December 8. Kohli has reportedly ended his long-term association with Puma to invest in Agilitas.

Not England, but India are trendsetters in T20I cricket now: Phil SaltPhilip Salt hails India as the new trendsetters in T20I cricket after their 2024 World Cup win. Their unbeaten streak and top ICC ranking signal a shift in global T20 dominance.

Shakib Al Hasan eyes swansong in Bangladesh as political, selection hurdles lingerFormer captain Shakib Al Hasan wants one last chance to play in Bangladesh colours. Now it is up to the selectors and authorities to decide if the country's biggest star gets a final goodbye.

Potential vs process: India were outthought by Germany in Junior World Cup semisHockey Junior World Cup 2025: Germany showed India the difference between talent and preparation. Now comes the real test—whether these lessons survive beyond heartbreak and become the steel that shapes tomorrow's champions.

Ashes: Nathan Lyon is pissed. But Steve Smith says Gabba axe right callMichael Neser took a crucial five-wicket haul to help Australia win the second Ashes Test. His performance justified the controversial decision to bench Nathan Lyon in the all-seam attack.

India vs South Africa: Men in Blue Arrive in Bhubaneswar for T20 Series OpenerOn this news bulletin, the focus is on the Indian cricket team's arrival in Bhubaneswar ahead of the highly anticipated five-match T20 series against South Africa. The series opener is scheduled for tomorrow, December 9, at the Barabati Stadium in Cuttack. Visuals capture a grand welcome for the 'Men in Blue' with enthusiastic fans cheering and traditional drumming resonating around the airport arrival area. The team, led by captain Suryakumar Yadav, looks to continue their winning momentum after successfully wrapping up the ODI series. The programme highlights the palpable excitement building up in Odisha as the cricketing action shifts to the shortest format. Security and arrangements are in place as the city gears up to host the international fixture.

Ro-Ko against the world: How Rohit, Kohli are pushing each other to World Cup 2027Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli have started pushing each other on the field to keep themselves ready for their mission of making it to the 2027 World Cup. Along with lifting themselves up, the South Africa series underlined their importance to the Indian squad with their experience and vibes.

Shubman Gill links up with team India after recovering from neck injuryIndia's T20I vice captain Shubman Gill has rejoined the team after completing rehabilitation for his neck injury. Gill was ruled out of the Test and ODI series against South Africa after injuring himself in the first Test.

Has Joe Root done enough to take over from Sachin Tendulkar as Test GOAT?Star England batter Joe Root has finally got rid of the only blemish of his illustrious Test career after scoring his first century in Australia. However, has he done enough to earn the tag of Test 'GOAT' as he inches closer to overtake Sachin Tendulkar as the highest run scorer of the format.

It could be 5-0: Micheal Vaughan fears the worst for England in AshesAshes: Former England captain Michael Vaughan fears the worst for Ben Stokes' team. Vaughan feels that if England do not drastically improve, they might be whitewashed by Australia in the 5-match series.

Pratika Rawal rewarded Rs 1.5 crore by Delhi government for Women's World Cup heroicsFrom wheelchair-bound celebrations to a ₹1.5 crore reward, Pratika Rawal's World Cup journey became a powerful symbol of resilience as Delhi honoured one of its brightest new sporting stars.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
